Python Introspection

Examine the type or properties of an object at runtime

Created by lastmayday / @lastmayday

What is "Type introspection" ?

  • 维基百科
  • 内省/自我检查

Why Use Introspection?

  • 判断某个变量是什么类型
  • 检查某个类的属性
  • ...

To Be Brief

内省可以让我们在代码运行的时候动态地判断某个对象的属性而使代码具有灵活性

How To Use Introspection?

Use build-in functions

  • type()
  • dir()
  • isinstance()
  • id()
  • getattr()
  • hasattr()
  • ...

Example 1

                      
In [1]: class Duck(object):
   ...:     def __init__(self, name):
   ...:         self.name = name
   ...:     def quack(self):
   ...:         print("%s is quacking." % self.name)
   ...:         

In [2]: dir(Duck)
Out[2]: 
['__class__',
 '__delattr__',
 '__dict__',
 '__dir__',
 '__doc__',
 '__eq__',
 '__format__',
 '__ge__',
 '__getattribute__',
 '__gt__',
 '__hash__',
 '__init__',
 '__le__',
 '__lt__',
 '__module__',
 '__ne__',
 '__new__',
 '__reduce__',
 '__reduce_ex__',
 '__repr__',
 '__setattr__',
 '__sizeof__',
 '__str__',
 '__subclasshook__',
 '__weakref__',
 'quack']

In [3]: duck_a = Duck("A")

In [5]: duck_a.quack()
A is quacking.

In [6]: id(duck_a)
Out[6]: 3059151500

In [7]: duck_b = duck_a

In [8]: id(duck_b)
Out[8]: 3059151500

In [9]: duck_c = Duck("C")

In [10]: id(duck_c)
Out[10]: 3059174796

In [11]: duck_b.name = "B"

In [12]: duck_a.quack()
B is quacking.

Example 2

                      
In [13]: class A(object):
   ....:     pass
   ....: 

In [14]: class B(A):
   ....:     pass
   ....: 

In [15]: isinstance(A(), A)
Out[15]: True

In [16]: type(A()) == A
Out[16]: True

In [17]: isinstance(B(), A)
Out[17]: True

In [18]: type(B()) == A
Out[18]: False

Write Your Own Functions

Examples

                      
In [1]: class Foo(object):
   ...:     def __init__(self, val):
   ...:         self.value = val
   ...:         

In [2]: foo = Foo('test')

In [3]: foo.value
Out[3]: 'test'

In [4]: foo.__dir__()
Out[4]: 
['__setattr__',
 '__reduce_ex__',
 '__new__',
 '__getattribute__',
 '__format__',
 '__class__',
 'value',
 '__delattr__',
 '__le__',
 '__repr__',
 '__hash__',
 '__doc__',
 '__ge__',
 '__ne__',
 '__module__',
 '__eq__',
 '__str__',
 '__reduce__',
 '__subclasshook__',
 '__dir__',
 '__gt__',
 '__dict__',
 '__sizeof__',
 '__weakref__',
 '__lt__',
 '__init__']

In [5]: class Bar(object):
   ...:     def __init__(self, val):
   ...:         self.val = val
   ...:     def __dir__(self):
   ...:         print(self.val)
   ...:         

In [6]: bar = Bar("test")

In [7]: bar.val
Out[7]: 'test'

In [8]: bar.__dir__()
test
